etymology.description: Depicts a torch with a flame on top, symbolizing guidance or leadership
etymology.interpretation: The character 主(主) (zhǔ, "master") represents a torch with a flame, symbolizing a guiding or leading figure, akin to a master or lord providing direction.

examples.chinese: 他是我们家的主(他是我們家的主)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒmen jiā de zhǔ.
examples.english: He is the master of our family.

examples.chinese: 僧侣虔诚祷告主(僧侶虔誠禱告主)。
examples.english: The monks devoutly prayed to the Lord.

examples.chinese: 臣子忠心辅佐主(臣子忠心輔佐主)。
examples.english: The ministers loyally assist their master.
